Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel, beware of thermostat settings”
Reviews.Author: pnear
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family prior to a flight out of Orlando. The room was spacious and nicely appointed, with a modern feel to it. Plenty of space for my family of four. The only issue/warning I have for others is related to the thermostat. I'm a light sleeper, so prefer to set the room fan to "on" which provides white noise and minimizes the on/off cycling of the HVAC system. In most hotels, this means that the fan stays on but the compressor turns on or off to regulate the temperature. In this hotel, when you turn the fan to the on position that means that the air conditioner will run continuously. We woke up frozen, and while the thermostat was set to 69 degrees the room was actually at 59 degrees! Otherwise the hotel is fine, but I won't be coming back due to the meat-locker effect of the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Recently refurbished quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: The room appears to have been recently redone and are decorated very tastefully. The rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast had a good selection and was never low on any items. The hotel is only 3 minutes for the Orlando Airport and is perfect for a brief stay. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveller562
Reviews.Content: Travelling on business in Orlando (with corporate offices near the resort areas) can be challenging. I found that the hotels near the corporate office to be very worn out, most likely due to the fact they are predominantely used by families. Fortunately, I found the Residence Inn Orlando Airport for one of my trips. The location is very convenient to all the major highways. My initial impression was that the hallways were exceptionally clean. My L-Shaped room was also very clean. The hotel room has the feel of the newer, smaller, Residence Inns, but I found that the carpet, tile, and kitchen area to be very clean as well. The complimentary breakfast is well-stocked and features some different hot entries every day, as well as the regular staples. While the exercise room is quite small, (maximum capacity 10) it was equipped with two treadmiles, two eliptical machines, and two bikes. During my stay, I only encountered one other traveller in the exercise room. There are also a few chain restaurants withint a few walking blocks, and many, many restaurants nearby on the large SR-436 thoroughfare. Overall, I would stay here again, and would recommend the hotel to a fellow business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Visit worked great ...”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Came down to Orlando to do SeaWorld with the kids and some outlet shopping. We stayed 3 nights. Continental breakfast was truly outstanding, rooms were great and we had a good time. My only two very minor complaints would have to be the elevator situation and those tiny, tiny carts to haul stuff to your room. First off, the the elevators just seemed smaller than the usual hotel, and at one point I had to wait 6 or 7 straight openings to get my cart onto one of them because they were slow and loaded with people. That was frustrating. And our tiny cart flipped with all the stuff we had to haul to have the kids there. Seriously, these were minor things because the overall experience was good -- but hey, let's get some bigger sturdier carts for families and can the elevators go any faster? I know they can't be made bigger now, but faster somehow?

Reviews.Title: “Great pet-friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: Peggy33436
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights in Orlando at the Residence Inn by the airport, staying with my teenage children and small dog. The Residence Inn Orlando Airport is a great place to stay with your dog. There are lots of sidewalks and grassy areas around the hotel, and the traffic is very light (at least on the weekends). The complimentary breakfast was delicious all three days. The breakfast attendant was amazing. She was warm and friendly and kept every dish full and all the counters cleaned. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a suite with 2 queen beds in the bedroom and a sleeper sofa in the living room. There were plenty of pillows on each bed. The only complaint I have is that the elevators are extremely slow. We were on the 6th floor. With every dog walk, I feel like I waited at least a minute or two for the elevator to make it up to the 6th floor, and then it took another minute or two to get to the bottom. If you stay at this hotel with your dog, request a room on the first or second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot for Small Conferences”
Reviews.Author: BobinOdessa
Reviews.Content: I searched Tripadvisor for a hotel in which to host a conference meeting and ended up selecting this hotel due to its amenities and excellent group rate room discount. The hotel is located within a short distance of the airport--close enough that it's only a 10 minute trip, but far enough so that air traffic noise isn't a problem. Free airport shuttle service is also available. I was rather taken aback by the spaciousness of the suites, which consisted of an attached kitchenette/living room, large bedroom, and bath. My only complaint was that the air conditioning in my room broke in the middle of the night; however, I was immediately provided with another room. The conference room was comfortable and had a good view; it also has an Ethernet connection, which is good thing since the wireless Internet connection is rather intermittent. Service was excellent and the complimentary breakfast and happy hour were nice touches. All ten people in our meeting were well pleased with this hotel and asked that we stay there again should a future meeting be held in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Major Help”
Reviews.Author: koshow13
Reviews.Content: Gold Marriott members and stay exclusively at Marriott properties. When we stay at a Marriott Hotels we expect at best a clean room. We understand properties are aging but this went beyond. The first thing we saw was a soiled couch. I wouldn't expect anyone to sit on it. Then upon entering the bathroom the rim of the toilet was literally black. If it wasn't that we were here for just one night and flying out the next day I would have booked another hotel, probably a Marriott but not this one. Even went as far as to clean the dishes before our ordered out food came and was totally appalled to find a used sponge underneath the sink. RU kidding! We're not complainers but this takes the cake! Not happy at all. Let the hotel know via guest comments... hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: jjkittycat
Reviews.Content: I used my husbandâ€™s points to get a suite for us at Residence Inn by Orlando airport. The suite worked out for the whole family: us, two kids and the grandma. The front desk was very prompt and friendly. The room was very clean but I did notice some wearing marks on the leather sofa. One TV in a two queen sized beds bedroom for kids and another one in the living room for adults. Full size frig and the whole set of stuff for cooking. We also noticed the complimentary breakfast had more choices than other Residence inns we stayed before. We have asked the shuttle to airport. The front desk has suggested a time for us. By the time we walked out the elevator, the drive greeted us right there and helped us with the luggage. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near airport. Good Residence Inn standard.”
Reviews.Author: ClarkCreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night before flying out of Orlando and was very pleased with the hotel and my stay. This Residence Inn was a good model of the quality of that brand. The evening reception was well stocked with good variety and the morning breakfast actually had better variety and quality than most Residence Inns. The 2-room suite was clean and modern, and other than hearing planes during the night, provided a good sleep environment. They had two free computers, but the connection speed was very slow. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: amlunchlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a shuttle from the airport and is within comfortable walking distance to many eateries. It made for a great one night pre-cruise stop. The pool was cold, but the hot tub was great. My husband made use of the basketball hoops and though not the best of court surfaces, it was a good bit of outdoor excercize after our flight down to FL. The staff was exceptionally nice. They gave us maps, directions, and suggestions as to where to eat and where the Walgreens was. The evening reception was very nice and the breakfast buffet was adequate to curb any hunger pangs on our car ride out to Port Canaveral. I loved the room. Very well kept and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: tanfan
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Residence Inn Orlando Airport and enjoyed our short stay. We arrived in time for the Managers reception which was like a buffet of appetizers! Who needs dinner after a spread like that? The breakfast was equally as good! Rooms typical of Residence Inn...very clean and roomy. We used the airport shuttle which was very quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Standard”
Reviews.Author: Grocer8
Reviews.Content: Was Disappointed With This Res Inn... Although it was the same fine layout as other Res Inns That We Stayed At On Our Trip The Rooms Condition Was Old And Tired...Frayed Carpet, Well Used Furniture, dirty grouting in bathroom, on the plus side good breakfast, excellent staff,

Reviews.Title: “Great locate, friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Deckwalker
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle from airport. Very responsive staff. Updated clean rooms, TVs, free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “A good place after a late flight”
Reviews.Author: cathynWindsor
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel to stay after arriving around 11 pm at the airport before heading to stay on-site at Universal Studios. Had a 1 -bdrm suite, which was clean, spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was good and the staff was very nice. Only complaint was the mattress was hard as a rock. We stay frequently at Residence Inns and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiredofthis123
Reviews.Content: My family and i traveled here to stay for a night prior to cruising to the Bahamas. It was a beautiful hotel, waterfall, staff, food, the rooms were fantastic! If I would have known that the rooms were so big and had so much extra space I would not have gotten two. THere was literally enough space to put a extra bed, a crib and a rollaway-in the livingroom! It was amazing, the beds were great of course and the staff was very pleasant as always with Marriott. I would definitely stay here again. It was walking distance to about ten restaurants. LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!!Yes, don't forget in the evening they have light appetizers, wine and beer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great amenities - slooooow internet access”
Reviews.Author: ABitSpoiled
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is great - except the free internet access. Yes, it's free, which is good, but it consistently ran at less than 1Mbps which made work almost impossible. This is a great hotel otherwise - everything you'd expect from a Residence Inn. Rooms are great, clean, and the hotel is in a great location. But I had to write this review so that you are aware that you won't be able to do much work if you are staying here for business. I tried the wired connection and it was bad - I did not try the wireless signal so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “This was a blessing for a very miserable time.”
Reviews.Author: Nanayoung
Reviews.Content: The rooms,beds,staff and housekeeping were top of the line. I also loved being able to bring my dog Dudley. We all enjoyed our 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen and 2 baths. Perfect would stay again and recommend this place to anyone. Good location rooms breakfast evening snacks everything was awesome

Reviews.Title: “Had problems which management fixed”
Reviews.Author: FOSHOU
Reviews.Content: I rate a hotel not only on its value, but also on its service. The room was clean but the air condition went out. Management did several things to try to make us comfortable and finally moved us to another room. Further, they refunded our room cost because we were so uncomfortable. I received an email from the general manager the next morning apologizing for all we went through the night before. I would stay here again because of this service. The hotel is a "one night, before you fly" type property. Great for the end of your family trip to Orlando. However, I don't think I would want to stay here for more than two nights. Lastly, get your gas, food and grocery products before you leave Orlando proper. Everything near the hotel is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location and Lots of Free Extras”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in july for one week while attending a training course in orlando. The location is 2 minutes from the airport and in a great central location for exploring orlando. Universal Studios and the outlets were to the west and it took about 20 minutes to drive there. The hotel is located in an area with all of the other major hotels and there are many dining options within walking distance ( Chilis, Dennys, Tony Romas, Sonnys, TGIF, Longhorn Steakhouse, bonefish and hooters). I had originally been booked to stay at the Marriott up the street, but switched to this hotel based on the positive reviews from tripadvisor and I am glad that I made the switch. This hotel is fairly new and the rooms are in good condition. The hotel offers free breakfast ( cereal, yogurt, waffles, pancakes, sausage patties, scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, juice, tea, coffee ) and a free evening reception ( wine, beer, hot dogs, chili, bbq sausages, cheeses, tacos). This hotel also offers free wireless internet ( a little slow ), free parking, guest laundry on several floors ($1.50 per load), a business center with 2 computers equipped with internet access and free printing, a great pool area with hot tub and BBQ for use by guests.There is a walmart just up the street where you can pick up your own groceries and incidentals. Overall i was very pleased with this hotel and the friendlness and helpfulness of the front desk staff. This is a great hotel for both business travellers and people travelling with kids. One thing to note is that this hotel does not have a full service restaurant or room service, but there is a pantry at the front desk to buy snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: VicenteFox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to visit area attractions with young son. Great service, clean rooms, good maid service, no complaints. Well except the queen bed, we think every hotel should have king sized if it's a single bed. Couple of words of warning, no covered entryway if you arrive during a rainstorm, and on hot days there are only a few spots in the parking lot with shade opportunities. Great breakfast buffet, also nice "happy hour", several days we did not eat out at all. Pool was shaded throughout morning in July making it a great time for swimming lessons for my son. Visited Kennedy Space Center and Sea World from here easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a housekeeping surprise”
Reviews.Author: Signet01
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but when my family of five arrived, we found that the pullout couch had no sheets or blankets. When we asked the front desk clerk for these, she acted as if we were inconveniencing her and her staff. A few minutes later, sheets and blankets were delivered, but simply handed to my wife without a word or an offer to assist. We have come to expect a bit better than this from the Marriott chain, but perhaps everyone has an off day now and again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: asualumni87
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised when my family arrived here. Updated with stainless steel appliances and granite countertops. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was very roomy and clean. The beds were super comfy. Nice complimentary breakfast with standard fare. Evening reception was a very nice bonus with beer, wine and light snacks! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: thecajungent
Reviews.Content: Check in went flawless. The room type we requested was waiting for us after a weary day of travel. Very stylish, clean, functional and COOL.. The beds were comfortable with nice linens. Suite was well appointed. Breakfast was excellent complete with waffles, pancakes, eggs and sausage, along with healthy choices such as cereals, fruit, yogurts etc. Staff were very helpful and attentive. I really can't think of a bad thing to say about my stay here. I'll choose this hotel the next time I'm in the area, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ottawatravelbug70
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at this hotel because we were on our way to a cruise. Free shuttle buses to and from the airport. We were told we won't have to wait for more than 10 to 15 minutes for a shuttle after we call the hotel. But we had to wait for more than 30 minutes. Not too bad ... but we had a very tired 3 year old. Over all the hotel is really nice and clean. I have stayed many times at Marriott Residence Inns in various cities in North America and this one was like most others - new, clean, and great service. We got a double adjoining suite for the family. Rooms were clean, furnished well, beds were really good. Breakfast next day was great like most other Residence Inns. We took the free shuttle back to the airport as this was where the bus to the cruise port would pick us up. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Picky111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with a group of five collegues for a business trip. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable and very clean. The bed was comfy and I slept well here. The little kitchen is well equipped if you feel like preparing food. The hotel is very convenient to the airport and there are many restaurants within walking distance. Beware of the closest gas stations - they charge about double for gas compared to one a mile up the road - they are trying to rip off people returning cars to the airport and don't even post their prices by the road. Only problem I had was that NBC wasn't available. I called the desk, they acted surprised and said they'd take care of it, but they never called back and it took two days for resolution. It apparently was a hotel wide problem and I didn't think they handled it very well. Otherwise the service was friendly and helpful. Free breakfast is nice. There was a pretty good variety and I think most people would be satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: tnshsms
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here before our cruise and it was an excellent choice. The driver to pick us from the airport was quick and nice and we checked in with no hassles. Our room was spacious and clean and the pull out sofa was somewhat comfortable. Our 2 yo slept on it and it was great for her. The manager's reception of chili was a nice touch but we ate at the Chili's that is just behind the hotel(through two hotel parking lots...a 5 min walk, no major streets to cross which was nice with our 2 yo) before we realized the hotel had quite the spread. The pool looked nice but we didn't get in. The little grocery cupboard was good, nothing special but it had a few good things. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mmiller623
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Very convenient location to airport and everything else. Comfortable rooms, VERY comfortable bed, everything you could need when staying away from home. Highly recommend this location. The staff were always courteous and helpful. I am sorry that I do not have any pictures to share, but you really wont go wrong when selecting this hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful designed rooms. Loved everything about it except the air-conditioner. It was blowing on us when we slept. After 10 minutes, we shut it off completely, because it was obnoxiously cold on us. We picked the two queens. Lots of room. Pool is interesting. The workout room was good. Breakfast was so neat. Waffle making machine was a big hit. One can also make a chocolate chip waffle. Good place for flying in on a late night trip and need to sleep quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our one night near MCO”
Reviews.Author: seventogo
Reviews.Content: Arrived at MCO around 1pm. Called the hotel for information on getting the shuttle over. Gentleman answering the phone was so very courteous and helpful. Check in was simple, and soon we were enjoying chairs poolside! We enjoyed the pool and hot tub, and then enjoyed the complimentary cocktails and snacks before we walked to the nearby Chili's for dinner. The morning buffet was excellent, plenty of choices, and complimentary! I took my time and had several cups of coffee. My younger son used the basketball court for a bit before we headed out. Took the free shuttle back to the airport in the morning to meet up with our college age kids that were flying in, we took a rental car from there. The shuttle service was always simple and the drivers were friendly and helpful. I will use this Residence Inn again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport choice...”
Reviews.Author: edtoby007
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all the Marriott properties at the entrance to Orlando airport and this is the nicest. Very elegant for a Residence Inn and < 2 years old. Nice breakfast area, nightly happy hours, nice pool, even a basketball court. Rooms are immaculate and well designed, perfect for a solo night or extended stay. The location is perfect for the airport, only a 5 minute drive. This property is adjacent to a Fairfield Inn as well as a SpringHill Suites. If you're a Marriott die hard, the full serve Marriott and Renaissance are close by but both charge for parking. The Courtyard and Fairfield are only average in my opinion. There are a couple of restaurants you can walk to- East Pearl Chinese which is very good- also a Denny's and Tony Roma. There is a Bonefish Grill and Friday's across the main road. I recommend Miller's Pub, about a mile up Semoran Blvd- good local place, lots of draft beer and good seafood. RENTAL CAR GAS WARNING- if you're looking to re-fuel your rental, there are two independent gas stations close by however they do not post their prices. They are notorious price gougers, currently the price is $5.49/gallon! Go one mile further and you'll find a 7/11 and Race Trac stations that have competitive prices (currently $3.47).

Reviews.Title: “OOPPS, we forgot to tell you that your reservation was cancelled!”
Reviews.Author: blessedbunch5
Reviews.Content: I am leaving this review because I was rather surprised how they handled an overbooking situation. My husband and I booked this hotel as our last night before an early flight in the morning. Upon check-in, the lady at the desk indicated that we had cancelled our reservation. WHAT? Thankfully, I had printed off my confirmation e-mail before leaving home and showed it to the front desk. She looked puzzled, walked to another manager and talked discretely. They both came back up and told us we had been re-booked at the Renaissance just a few blocks away. We made sure we were to get free breakfast and all other amenities we originally were expecting. The manager indicated there was no hot tub (but thankfully she was wrong) They were polite and apologized. I am surprised how it was handled however. The front desk should be prepped with a list of "bumped" customers so that they look like they know what they are doing. I feel my reaction would have been different if I didn't have to prove I had a reservation. The Renaissance front desk was courteous but the changing of the guard proved to be upsetting as we had to keep calling to get charges removed..parking, internet and breakfast. We were however glad in the end to be bumped up to a much nicer establishment!

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace to Marriott”
Reviews.Author: disfaninnyc
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation here a couple of weeks ago. When we got there,we were told they had overbooked and no rooms were available. Inexcusable and badly handled. We are big fans of Marriott;this place is not among a hotel we would recommend.Management needs a wake up call as to what a confirmed reservation actually is

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel by the Airport”
Reviews.Author: CADream1n
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect from an Airport hotel. But we wanted a place with the airport shuttle so we stayed here. The rooms were very clean an extremely spacious. Marriott's have great beds and comfortable pillows. There were no issues at all with being near the airport, we didn't hear a single plane go by. We were within walking distance of some good restaurants and breakfast was more than some bagels and cereal. They actually had hot items for breakfast (pancakes, waffles, eggs, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Hardest Working Breakfast Staff in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBunny2001
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent our Holiday (12/18-12/25) at this hotel. The breakfast staff worked realy hard every morning of my stay. Christan never stopped moving and always had a smile. The front desk staff were also great. This was the first time I was at a hotel and the internet worked perfectly. We travel with 4 laptops and my family did not have one complaint. The problems I had with this hotel had nothing to do with any persons working at the hotel. My issues are with Marriott. The breakfast area does not allow the line to flow. You have to ask people to move to the side or wait for them to move so you may retrieve the food you would like. The video that shows the design flaw is a perfect example of one of many design flaws. It was hard to use the drawers in front of the bed. You have to open the refrigerator door to open the stove. The television in the living area will not swivel due to the security device attached to it. The design flaws are easy to adjust to and I would certainly return to the hotel due to the hard working, polite, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tenr2th
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent rate on marriott.com for a single night business stay. A very clean, quiet and comfortable facility with a good breakfast. Can't ask for much more. Great proximity to the airport (though I wasn't leaving from there). A big plus being away from Disney, no lobby/restaurant filled with screaming unruly kids. Accessible to highway. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: DeepScapeNine
Reviews.Content: We really liked our hotel room. Everything is clean and modern. We would absolutely stay here again. It was one of the nicest places with a kitchenette that we've every stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 week stay will stay again in the future very nice new hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: eman500
Reviews.Content: We just recently returned from a week down in the orlando area, stayed 7 nights, pet friendly for a small fee, it is not a bad drive to seaworld, aquatica, about 20 mins with traffic, avoid the toll roads as this hotel is close to the beachline toll road, just minutes from wal-mart, publix, more about this hotel, the furniture is new, everything is new about this hotel, outdoor pool, basketball court, Great breakast served daily from 6-10, they also have free beer in the afternoons from 5:30 to 7:30 with a light dinner, which is not bad either, the rooms all have a full equipped kitchen, overall i would stay here again, the staff is also very friendly and will accomadate you with any needs you may have

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with added amenities - but it's a drive to Disney”
Reviews.Author: GDwhitby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after landing in Orlando because the house we rented was not available to us until the following day. This was a nice hotel - clean, quiet, and with friendly staff. I liked the fact that it has a full kitchen in the room for about the same price as other hotels that don't offer this. This would be a good hotel for an extended stay in Orlando, except there isn't really much in the immediate area. The drive to Disney from here was a solid 25 minutes, so you probably wouldn't want to do that every day if you are a park-goer. There are some grocery stores etc if you drive down the road a bit. In general, a nice place to stay near the airport, but not a longer term option if you in Orlando for the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Property”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl310
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Residence Inn Orlando Airport prior to moving to The Peabody Orlando to attend the Elks National Convention at the Orlando Convention Center the first week of July. We had a one-bedroom unit that was clean, modern and, most importantly, offered a wonderfully comfortable king bed. The kitchen was well-equipped and provided an area to store snacks and drinks. We did not actually cook there, as we did one day at EPCOT then ventured out the next day to visit the Kennedy Space Center, the highlight of our entire trip. The breakfast area was clean and the male assistant there was incredibly helpful, as we often arrived just as they were shutting down the breakfast bar as our bodies were still on West Coast time. He'd offer to make a fresh pot of coffee or mysteriously appear with fresh scrambled eggs when most of the serving urns were empty. The front-desk staff were very helpful in handing us pre-printed routings to the various tourist attractions, and even helped us find the nearest Joe's Crab Shack shortly after our arrival. It is about a half hour's drive from the hotel to Disney, but I'd stay here again to avoid the hustle and bustle of the Disney area. Most of those we encountered at the Residence Inn appeared to be business travelers and not vacationing families. That was a plus for us. There is a wonderful Chinese restaurant right around the corner, and I'm sorry I don't remember its name. China Pearl, maybe? I would recommend this property to anyone visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Most Elegant Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: JJudy
Reviews.Content: We frequently stay at Residence Inn wherever we travel. Our family with two young children stayed here the last night of Orlando vacation as we had to get up to catch an ealry flight and this hotel was more reasonable priced than our theme park hotel. This one is a very new hotel, with room furniture and beds comparable to more expensive hotel chains. The kitchen in our room had all new stainless steel applicances. The double room we had was far more elegant than the average Residence Inn room that we had experienced in the past. The buffet service in the afternoon had red and white wine to choose from. Unlike Orlando hotels closer to the theme parks, this hotel seemed to be more sophisticated with less children and more business travellers. Service was friendly and accommodating. The hotel is a five minute drive to Orlando International Airport. The one complaint was the fitness room seemed to be neglected with one tread mill that did not work and no clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mmuscs
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for 3 days on business. I had to be downtown for a meetings so I was not sure where I wanted to stay. I decided to rent a car and stay close to the airport. I got in about 10:30 at night, got the car and left the airport. If you go north towards downtown from the sirport stay in the right hand lane. When you see the Hooters, that a right go the the first stop sign take a left and you will see the hotel on your left. It is easy to find. There are numerous places to eat in the area. The young man that checked me in was extremely pleasant and helpful. Check in was simple and quick. They do have a shuttle and he asked if I had taken the shuttle from the airport since someone had called. He wanted to make sure if it was me I had made it. It wasn't but the lady that had called came in shortly thereafter. The rooms were clean. They had plenty of towels. The bed was comfortable. the next morning I had a shower and the water pressure was very good. The breakfast was very nice. I made it downtown and back for my meeting. Spent another night and then flew home. It was a quick trip but it was worth it. This was spring break and if there were a bunch of noiseie kids, I never heard them.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Travels
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed an overnight stay at this property before flying out the next day. I found the front desk staff very friendly and helpful. There was spacious lounging areas available. The included buffet breakfast was more than adequate with hot and cold food, various fruits, juices coffee etc. I also thought the room appearance and set up were stellar. Probably the best looking residence inn I've stayed out, you can tell it's fairly new. It has an outdoor pool and fitness center that I didn't have a chance to use. It's located fairly close the airport and is next to and on the same block as several other hotels. I had a king bed studio suite which was nicely arranged. It included a spacious dressing area/closet between bedroom and bathroom which I really liked, would have been great for a long stay. Nice workdesk and table areas, also comfortable sofa etc. I would not hesitate to go back and actually wished I'd been able to just kick back and enjoy my suite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean Rooms, and Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Crimmy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn for business. This is one of the nicest Marriot hotels I have stayed in. The room was clean and spacious. The service is excellent. The bed.... I could go on about the bed. The bed was so comfortable. I even had a feather free room - which I am allergic to down so that made my sleep even more enjoyable. This is a great hotel to stay in if you are on business. The kitchen helps you save money and allows you to avoid eating out for every meal which is a nice touch when you are away from home. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you want to go to the theme parks as it is far away from them. However, if you are on business and want a nice place to stay, then reserve a room here. I can't say anything bad about the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel with stylish and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimandremy
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. front desk employee was very nice and accommodating upon our late arrival. comfortable breakfast. shuttle service was slow from airport, but prompt returning to airport. room was well decorated and beds were super comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravelMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one Friday night prior to our disney cruise with 2 kids. Really pretty hotel and nice rooms with comfy beds. Would probably be a great place to stay longer with a family since the kitchen was very nice. Breakfast in the morning was convenient. Pretty lobby with a "waterfall" my kids thought was pretty cool. Close to the airport, but very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott is the best!”
Reviews.Author: gemss
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 night layover at the Residence Inn and it was excellent. The room was very clean and comfortable and their beds are like sleeping on a cloud! The free breakfast buffet was a great start to our day.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MsSlaveX
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this particular hotel in April (I have since stayed 3 times), the rooms are clean and the staff is courteous and professional. Only problem is the surrounding restaurants not much to chose from we had to go to International Blvd. But as far the hotel itself, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cov Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an extended family reunion/vacation in the Orlando area. For the first part of our trip (the vacation), we stayed at the Floridays Resort (see my review). The remainder of the trip (the reunion) was at the Residence Inn Orlando Airport. Usually our family reunions are at 4-star hotels with many conveniences and amenities. This year, we decided to keep it simpler. However, the family was truly impressed with this hotel. I understand it's fairly newly built. Close enough to the airport to catch a last minute flight on time, but air plane noise was not a problem at all. We managed to get a special reunion rate of $74/night! Everyone was impressed by how luxurious the rooms were for this class of hotel. We enjoyed 1-bdrm suites with either a king or 2-queen beds. Very nice decor, earthtone colors with woodgrain finishes all over. Lots of amenities were available: kitchen with stove, microwave, refrig, utensils, cookware, dinnerware, coffee maker, etc. The bathrooms were clean and well-kept. 32-in flatscreen tv's in both the bedroom and living area. The beds were quite comfy with plush pillows. Even the pullout sofa was enjoyed by the kiddies. The breakfast buffet hit the mark everyone morning. Eggs, sausage, potatoes, waffles, cereals, variety of breads, fruit, juices, and of course, coffee, milk and tea. My family loves to eat, so the buffet was a hit with everyone. The hotel was near several others, so there were quite a few restaurants nearby and within a short 5 min. drive down the main road. The pool was clean and used often by some family members. Not as big as some of the resort pools, but sufficed. Check-in was quick and easy; housekeeping was on-time and very helpful whenever we needed extra supplies. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others..clean, comfortable, good location, and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “reliable quality, good service, convenience”
Reviews.Author: RVW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here so that we could be near the airport and also within reach of Kennedy Space Center. It is also close to Winter Park north of Orlando where there are several nice small art galleries and upscale bistros and out-of-the-way tourist things to do. We had a one-bedroom suite and it was really well arranged -- nice furniture, reasonable sized rooms without being excessive, well stocked kitchenette with everything we needed. Check-in and checkout were fast and simple (though we had booked ahead with them on the web, which no doubt made it faster. In general, no surprises, good quality, and we'd be happy to stay again. A nice extra was the good business-center room, with two workstations and lots of seating areas. Our one complaint was the breakfast area. A full breakfast was on hand every morning, all hot and cold items you might want, but the traffic flow was terrible -- food laid out in a crowded corner where everyone was guaranteed to bump into one another trying to find what they wanted or wait for something to cook through. Also -- plastic plates and cutlery, not china. We ended up taking our china plates down from our suite and using those. That's a minor issue though for a place that has high quality and solid value.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Not Top Ten”
Reviews.Author: G-Crew4
Reviews.Content: I like Residence Inns and generally look for them when I travel. While the property had the usual Residence Inn amenities, it was hard to find. It is not on the main road and there are no signs directing you even when you get close. I literally blundered upon it after driving around for a few minutes. The entrance from the road is also somewhat hazardous (huge dip coming out of the parking lot onto the road). I scraped the bottom of my car on it almost every time I drove in or out (and I don't drive that fast). These are minor things compared to my inability to get a good night's sleep while staying at this hotel. My first problem was the bed. The soft padding they put on upscale mattresses makes these beds very soft and this was the softest hotel bed I have had in the past 2-3 years. I like to lay flat but it was just impossible in a bed like this. But that was far from the only problem. The air system switched on and off through the night but whenever it came on the sound was very loud. It's really not that hard to make these systems quiet. I've never had a problem like this before and I travel a lot. Then there was the smoke alarm system mounted high on the wall with the two flashing (mini-strobe) lights. They flash every seven seconds and are quite bright. Personally, I like dark rooms and these lights were a major problem for me. I'm not sure why they did this. I noted all the other hotels I stayed at on this trip either didn't have lights at all or had very dim ones that didn't flash. If it wasn't so high up, I would have taped something over them at night. I did leave a note for the cleaning crew but they simply took it off the wall and threw it in the trash. The security systems on my laptop prevented me from using the wireless internet, so I needed the hotel lobby computer (there were two) to get directions and print boarding passes. Unfortunately, these computers were monopolized by web surfers and game players (this was true at other hotels as well). In addition, one of the computer was down for about a day during my stay. I would like to see the hotel put some limits on usage time (for the benefit of all guests). The bottom line is that I found this to be a good hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. They even gave me some extra Marriott Reward points when I sent these comments directly to their management. But it does not deserve to be rated in the top ten Orlando hotels on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the 2 bedroom / 2 bath suite!!!”
Reviews.Author: mishywashy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my husband and 4 children. The two bedroom / two bath suite was absoulutely wonderful. We were on vacation to Disneyworld and this residence inn was cheaper than the ones closer to the parks. Besides the drive to the parks, it was perfect!!! It was clean, comfortable, and spacious!!! The staff was friendly and was very attentive to our needs. I would stay here again and will never stay in a one room hotel room again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Great Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: ocrtech
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a one bedroom comfortably. This facility is 5 stories tall and solidly built unlike some older 2 story Residence Inns. The room is well insulated with no noise coming from surrounding rooms or rooms above. There is a standard Residence Inn size pool area along with a larger than standard hottub. Okay gym with a couple of treadmills and some dumbbell weights. Breakfast was adequate but not exceptional. Evening fare is only offered a couple times a week. Free wireleess and wired internet available in your room. The real benefit to this property is its 5 minute drive to the airport. There are definitely grander hotels in Orlando along with ones that are closer to the parks, however for those with early morning flights this property is definitely worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not third best in Orlando by any stretch”
Reviews.Author: jimglobe
Reviews.Content: How this hotel is number 3 in Orlando is beyond me??? It is a decent property, but not that great. My bathroom was dirty. The shower looked like it had not been cleaned since it was installed. The room was really noisy. Don't get one on the pool side. The partiers will keep you up until 1am or later no matter what time the sign says the pool closes. Dont expect the employees to enforce the pool closing. The breakfast was ok. Nothing great. They use stryofoam plates, bowls, and cups. I can't imagine how much of that stuff they are putting in landfills. Not environmentally friendly at all. Front desk was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Can I stay for awhile??”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMomof3
Reviews.Content: We arrived VERY late at the airport and were greeted with a shuttle to return us to the hotel. We took advantage of a promotion (or perhaps it is always offered) to park at the hotel for free and use the shuttle to the airport. We dropped our van off there for a week (saved us $120) at the beginning of our trip and stayed one night at the end. The free breakfast was nice- scrambled eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, Belgum waffles, fresh fruit, etc... What a nice change from other "continental breakfasts". The room was phenominal, spacious and the pillows/bed were WOW!! I would love to stay there longer. There was a nice pool/hot tub, but we didn't get a chance to use it. Nice computer station and the staff was very nice. Plenty of room for us and 3 teen/preteens. Even the sofa bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: Just checked out from a single night stay here close to Orlando International and cannot say enough good things about this property. I was very impressed with the desgin, layout and comfort of this hotel. It is a great value, offers all that you need for either a short or extended stay and I will no doubt return for future trips to Orlando. Rooms are nicely appointed, clean and offer ammenities that make you feel at home like a kitchen, pull out sofa, 2 flat panel LCD's, comfortable bed, seperate vanity area and well laid out room design. It is modern and homey, great job Marriott! Gym is suitable and clean, pool and hot tub are a plus and mini market by front desk is also a bonus. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN FLORIDA”
Reviews.Author: Heather-Piper
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at a Residence Inn, but I'm glad that we did! This has to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. We don't like the noise and crowds at the Resorts, so we always stay near the airport. This hotel is quiet, is close to shopping, restaurants, airport, and has excellent shuttle service. The staff (front desk, breakfast buffet servers, cleaning, etc) are extremely friendly, polite, competent and nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast buffet is kept very clean and is always well stocked. There is every kind of breakfast food available - sausages, eggs, potatoes, biscuits, wraps, waffles, toast, bagels, muffins, yogourt, hot and cold cereal, fresh fruit, juices, milk, coffee, tea. The food is absolutely delicious, and it's hard to believe that it is free! The hotel is so clean, there isn't a fingerprint on the walls in the hallway or a speck of lint on the carpet. At any time of the day you can see someone cleaning. The hotel also always smell fresh like it has been sprayed with Febreeze. One member of our family was in a wheelchair, and we had an accessible room which was fantastic. The shower had a fold down bench for him to sit on and safely have his shower. The beds were so comfortable and there was a flat screen tv in the living room and in the bedroom. It has a fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher, garbage disposal, full cutlery and dishes. This room was always spotless - thoroughly cleaned every day. The pool was great after a hot day at the parks. Water was warm and it was very relaxing. This was a very special trip for our family, and it was made even more special by our stay at this hotel. It is perfect for families, seniors, business people, leisure travellers, and especially those with special needs. If we ever return to this area, we will definitely be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best beds in orlando”
Reviews.Author: laurathompson
Reviews.Content: Nice clean comfortable rooms. Near to the airport but not noisy. The most comfy beds I have slept in away from home. The only negative was the ping of the elevators going up and down, but I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: labeckley
Reviews.Content: We were arriving on a late night flight into Orlando on our way to Disney World so decided to stay at a hotel by the airport for the first night. The Residence Inn was a perfect place to rest up from our long trip before the active days ahead of us. We caught the hotel shuttle from the airport; it was already there when we needed it so we didn't wait at all. The lady at the check-in desk was friendly and cheerful. We were all very pleased with our two bedroom suite; the rooms were quite comfortable and attractive, and we slept very well in the king and queen-sized beds. In the morning we enjoyed the included breakfast which consisted of eggs, sausage, waffles, muffins, bagels, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc. I was happy to see computers with complimentary internet access available in the lobby. I felt the management of the Residence Inn really thought of everything one would need for a comfortable stay, and provided it. Spacious, comfortable, well-appointed accomodations, friendly desk clerks, breakfast, internet access, prompt shuttle service -- it makes one wonder why some other hotels struggle with these basic things -- the Residence Inn makes it seem so easy. This hotel is an excellent value, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RC3KP
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night on March 18, before we went on a Disney Cruise. The hotel was was beautiful and clean, although when we got to our room we noticed the 2 bedroom suite only had 2 beds in it, when the reservationist told me it had 3. The lady at the front desk offered me another room for $69, so i took it, but kinda felt like i got shafted. In all, it was a nice night at a really nice hotel. recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Orlando Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 7024 Augusta National Drive, Orlando, FL 32822
